intro: Humboltia univaginata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or white. Humboltia univaginata is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
